page.title: 19Mining, A Future Callington?
page.content: { Mining}is a vastly expensive enterprise. Even the prospecting stage involves cost running into millions of pounds. If a prospect is found to be viable, mining companies the look for investment from investors. In the case of the mining operation in{Callington, thirty million pounds would be needed, a lot to ask in a time of recession. Mr. Gerald Pengilly feels that is investors could be found for the enterprise, Callingon could become a boom town, with jobs and wealth in pleanty. And Cornwall could become a pre-eminent mineral mining erea again. In Callingon and its environs lodes of{tin, copper, arsenic, wolfram, {tungsten, manganese and iron}exist, but in what degree and how economical it will be to extract is the question?
